fields.description:
h3. Summary
Wen updating a Service Desk ticket by selecting edit. The request participants field gets updated even though nothing was changed in the field. You see the Request Participants being updated by looking at the All tab under Activity and by checking the {{changeitem}} table in JIRA.
Screenshot of what you see below:
!Screen Shot 2015-06-29 at 6.26.30 PM.png|thumbnail!

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create an issue in a Service Desk Project
# Select the edit button
# update information but leave the Request Participants Field blank

h3. Expected Results
updated fields show up under the all activity tab 

h3. Actual Results
The fields that were updated show up and then request particpants field gets shown as update from blank to blank
 
h3. Notes
This only happens when clicking the edit button. Updating the ticket inline does not update the request participants field.

h3.Workaround
No current workaround
fields.summary: Request Participants Field Updated When Editing Issue

h3. Environment
This issue is experienced when using Oracle as a Database.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Attempt to access the 'Automation' section of JIRA Service Desk as in: [Automating your service desk|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/SERVICEDESK/Automating+your+service+desk]
# Observe that the area is inaccessible, and the browser fails to respond after clicking the 'Automation' link.


h3. Expected Results
The Automation configuration should be shown when clicking the 'Automation' link.

h3. Actual Results
The Screen greys out, and the user is unable to modify the automations of any service desk, an error is shown in the {{atlassian-jira.log}}

h3. Notes and Workaround.

This is caused by an empty value in the following table: {{AO_9B2E3B_IF_COND_CONF_DATA}} on in the {{CONFIG_DATA_VALUE}} column. Oracle is treating this as a null value as per [http://docs.oracle.com/cd/B28359_01/server.111/b28286/sql_elements005.htm#SQLRF51081] and subsequently users experience this bug.

To check if this issue applies to your instance, run the following SQL:

{code:SQL}
select NVL("CONFIG_DATA_VALUE",'-NULL-') AS "CONFIG_DATA_VALUE"  from "AO_9B2E3B_IF_COND_CONF_DATA";
{code}

And check for a {{NULL}} value (shown as {{-NULL-}} in the {{CONFIG_DATA_VALUE}} column.

If you identify that there are any 'null' values, modify the database so that the 'null' value is set to an empty value.

The following *example* (you will need to change this for your database) will update the NULL value for the record with the ID=10:
{code:SQL}
update "AO_9B2E3B_IF_COND_CONF_DATA" set "CONFIG_DATA_VALUE"='' where "ID" =10;
{code}

Note: We recommend backing up your database before modifying the database.
Additionally, direct database Modifications are not supported, however if you need assistance with determining the correct query to run, please contact Atlassian Support.

The root cause of this issue is unknown at this time. Please feel free to vote, comment or discuss any observation of this issue in your environment or contact [Atlassian Support|https://support.atlassian.com] as we would like to get to the bottom of this issue.

fields.description:
h3. Experienced Behavior

The JIRA Service Desk mail handler repeatedly tries to process a single message that throws an SQL Exception when inserting into `AO_2C4E5C_MAILITEMAUDIT`. This prevents processing of any new messages.

{noformat}
2015-06-25 21:31:42,530 ERROR [] atlassian-scheduler-quartz1.clustered_Worker-4 anonymous     MailJobRunner Failed
com.mysema.query.QueryException: Caught SQLException for insert into `AO_2C4E5C_MAILITEMAUDIT` (`MAIL_CHANNEL_ID`, `MAIL_ITEM_ID`, `HANDLER_NAME_KEY`, `RESULT_STATUS`, `MESSAGE`, `FROM_ADDRESS`, `MAIL_CHANNEL_NAME`, `SUBJECT`, `ISSUE_KEY`, `NO_OF_RETRY`, `CREATED_TIMESTAMP`, `UPDATED_TIMESTAMP`) values (?, ?, ?, ?, ?, ?, ?, ?, ?, ?, ?, ?)
	at com.mysema.query.sql.DefaultSQLExceptionTranslator.translate(DefaultSQLExceptionTranslator.java:38)
	at com.mysema.query.sql.Configuration.translate(Configuration.java:514)
	at com.mysema.query.sql.dml.SQLInsertClause.execute(SQLInsertClause.java:380)
	at com.atlassian.jira.internal.mail.processor.querydsl.QueryDslHelper$1.apply(QueryDslHelper.java:177)
	at com.atlassian.jira.internal.mail.processor.querydsl.QueryDslHelper$1.apply(QueryDslHelper.java:141)
	at com.atlassian.pocketknife.internal.querydsl.QueryFactoryImpl.insert(QueryFactoryImpl.java:161)
	at com.atlassian.jira.internal.mail.processor.querydsl.QueryDslHelper.create(QueryDslHelper.java:140)
	at com.atlassian.jira.internal.mail.processor.feature.audit.mailitem.MailItemAuditStore.createMailItemAudit(MailItemAuditStore.java:106)
	at com.atlassian.jira.internal.mail.processor.feature.audit.mailitem.MailItemAuditManager.saveMailItemAudit(MailItemAuditManager.java:40)
	at com.atlassian.jira.internal.mail.processor.feature.processor.MailHandlerWorker.saveAuditLog(MailHandlerWorker.java:143)
	at com.atlassian.jira.internal.mail.processor.feature.processor.MailHandlerWorker.handle(MailHandlerWorker.java:95)
	at com.atlassian.jira.internal.mail.processor.feature.processor.MailProcessorWorker.processMailItem(MailProcessorWorker.java:149)
	at com.atlassian.jira.internal.mail.processor.feature.processor.MailProcessorWorker.process(MailProcessorWorker.java:83)
	at com.atlassian.jira.internal.mail.processor.feature.processor.MailProcessorService.run(MailProcessorService.java:41)
	at com.atlassian.jira.internal.mail.processor.services.MailProcessorExecutor.run(MailProcessorExecutor.java:34)
	at com.atlassian.jira.internal.mail.processor.services.AbstractMailExecutor.execute(AbstractMailExecutor.java:48)
	at com.atlassian.jira.internal.mail.processor.services.MailJobRunner.runJob(MailJobRunner.java:38)
	at com.atlassian.scheduler.core.JobLauncher.runJob(JobLauncher.java:135)
	at com.atlassian.scheduler.core.JobLauncher.launchAndBuildResponse(JobLauncher.java:101)
	at com.atlassian.scheduler.core.JobLauncher.launch(JobLauncher.java:80)
	at com.atlassian.scheduler.quartz1.Quartz1Job.execute(Quartz1Job.java:32)
	at org.quartz.core.JobRunShell.run(JobRunShell.java:223)
	at org.quartz.simpl.SimpleThreadPool$WorkerThread.run(SimpleThreadPool.java:549)
Caused by: java.sql.SQLException: Incorrect string value: '\xF0\x9F\x92\x9C\x0D\x0A...' for column 'MESSAGE' at row 1
	at com.mysql.jdbc.SQLError.createSQLException(SQLError.java:1084)
	at com.mysql.jdbc.MysqlIO.checkErrorPacket(MysqlIO.java:4232)
	at com.mysql.jdbc.MysqlIO.checkErrorPacket(MysqlIO.java:4164)
	at com.mysql.jdbc.MysqlIO.sendCommand(MysqlIO.java:2615)
	at com.mysql.jdbc.MysqlIO.sqlQueryDirect(MysqlIO.java:2776)
	at com.mysql.jdbc.ConnectionImpl.execSQL(ConnectionImpl.java:2838)
	at com.mysql.jdbc.PreparedStatement.executeInternal(PreparedStatement.java:2082)
	at com.mysql.jdbc.PreparedStatement.executeUpdate(PreparedStatement.java:2334)
	at com.mysql.jdbc.PreparedStatement.executeUpdate(PreparedStatement.java:2262)
	at com.mysql.jdbc.PreparedStatement.executeUpdate(PreparedStatement.java:2246)
	at org.apache.commons.dbcp.DelegatingPreparedStatement.executeUpdate(DelegatingPreparedStatement.java:105)
	at org.apache.commons.dbcp.DelegatingPreparedStatement.executeUpdate(DelegatingPreparedStatement.java:105)
	at com.mysema.query.sql.dml.SQLInsertClause.execute(SQLInsertClause.java:366)
	... 20 more
{noformat}

The example above is caused by an email containing 4-byte UTF-8 and JIRA running on MySQL. See [JRA-21224 | https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRA-21224] for details.
* The offending character is in the message subject and as a result JIRA Service Desk tries to insert this character into `AO_2C4E5C_MAILITEMAUDIT`

h3. Expected Behavior: 

JIRA Service Desk mail handler should mark this message as FAILED and continue to the next new message. 

h3. Workaround
First, enable debug logging so that you can tell which message is causing problems. 
# Use [these instructions | https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/JIRAKB/Set+logging+level+for+a+package+in+JIRA] to add the {{com.atlassian.mail.incoming}} package and set it for DEBUG. 
# After waiting a few minutes for JIRA to attempt processing mail, review the log file to find the ID of the offending message. 
#* JIRA_HOME/log/atlassian-jira-incoming-mail.log
#* Look for the following: 
{noformat}
2015-06-25 21:31:42,483 DEBUG [] atlassian-scheduler-quartz1.clustered_Worker-4 anonymous     Found 20 mail item(s) for processing ...
2015-06-25 21:31:42,483 DEBUG [] atlassian-scheduler-quartz1.clustered_Worker-4 anonymous     Starts processing mail item [id: 2222] ...
2015-06-25 21:31:42,483 DEBUG [] atlassian-scheduler-quartz1.clustered_Worker-4 anonymous     Checking if mail item [id: 2222] is a mail loop ...
...
2015-06-25 21:31:42,526 ERROR [] atlassian-scheduler-quartz1.clustered_Worker-4 anonymous     Exception when MailHandlerWorker handles message: 
com.atlassian.jira.exception.DataAccessException: org.ofbiz.core.entity.GenericEntityException: while inserting:
...
{noformat}
** In this example ID 2222 is the offending message. 

The offending message must be removed in order for the mail processor to process any further mail. If you wish to recover the email content before deletion, follow the KB below:

* https://confluence.atlassian.com/pages/viewpage.action?pageId=728138770

Then you can proceed with deleting the offending message using the steps below:
# Backup the database
# Delete the message using the commands below:
{noformat}
delete from "AO_2C4E5C_MAILITEMCHUNK" where "MAIL_ITEM_ID" = <id from above>;
delete from "AO_2C4E5C_MAILITEM" where "ID" = <id from above>;
{noformat}

NOTE: For Cloud customer, please inform support team to perform troubleshooting and workaround for this bug.
fields.summary: SQL Exception Prevents New Mail From Being Processed

fields.description:
h3. Summary
Clicking on the Help Center link without being logged into JSD results in a 404 error

h3. Environment
- JIRA 6.4.7 configured with a context path in the Base URL (/jira647)
- JSD 2.5.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create a new Service Desk.
# Open a new session or log out of JSD.
# Access either the Help Center URL (<BASE_URL>/servicedesk/customer/portals) or a specific portal URL (<BASE_URL>/servicedesk/customer/portal/1).
# After being redirected to the login screen, click on the Help Center link on the upper banner.

h3. Expected Results
A login page should be displayed displayed.

h3. Actual Results
A 404 error page is displayed (_Oops, you've found a dead link._).
The access logs contain the entries below (in which {{jira647}} is the context path):
{noformat}
0:0:0:0:0:0:0:1 1003x2517x1 - [25/Jun/2015:16:43:13 -0300] "GET /jira647/servicedesk/customer/portal/1/user/undefined/servicedesk/customer/portals HTTP/1.1" 404 1020 14 "http://localhost:8647/jira647/servicedesk/customer/portal/1/user/login?destination=portal%2F1" "Mozilla/5.0 (Macintosh; Intel Mac OS X 10.9; rv:38.0) Gecko/20100101 Firefox/38.0" "7j5hmh"

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Service Desk Server*. Using *JIRA Service Desk Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JSDCLOUD-2028].
  {panel}

Hi,

We are currently preparing to deploy Jira Service Desk.

We have noticed that if you open an existing issue (within Service Desk) and hover over the STATUS value, explanatory text appears over the STATUS value which is very useful.

Similarly, if you perform the same action when viewing an issue in 'My requests' in the customer portal, the informative text does NOT appear.

Would it be possible to get this added so that it does appear in the customer portal?
This will prove very useful for customers interacting with the service desk.

Thanks,




Bernard Gorman
Samsung, Cambridge, UK
fields.summary: Useful to have informative text appear over STATUS value within in customer portal

h3. Summary
* Using Internet Explorer 9-JIRA 6.4.6-Service Desk 2.5.0
* In the queue listing, at "All Tickets" , the page link doesn work

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Click at the Service Desk tab above
# Choose service desk project intended
# On the left pane, under Queues, click All Tickets
# A list of tickets will shows up
# Click at the page number < 1 2 3 4 > 
# Nothing will happen
# Can only scroll through pages using the '<' & '>' arrow

h3. Expected Results
* Able to navigate through the list of tickets pages by clicking page number

h3. Actual Results
* Unable to navigate through the list of tickets pages by clicking page number

h3.Workaround
# Use the '<' & '>' arrow instead to scroll through pages
# Use other browser eg: Chrome

h2. Symptom
JIRA Service Desk and Redmine Importer are disabled after uninstalling JIRA Agile (See problem.png)

h2. Step to Reproduce
This is how I reproduced:
# Install vanilla JIRA 6.4.6 (current latest)
# Install JIRA Agile 6.7.4 (current latest) at 'Find add-ons'
# Install JIRA Service Desk 2.5.0 (current latest) at 'Find add-ons'
# Uninstall JIRA Agile at 'Manage add-ons'

h2. Findings
It happens if you install JIRA Agile and then JIRA Service Desk
It does not happen if you install opposite way (JIRA Service Desk -> JIRA Agile)

fields.description:
h2. Symptom
Red error dialogs appear if you install JIRA Service Desk after JIRA Agile.
- A red error dialog appears for only a moment when you go to the scrum board and only when you use Chrome (See problem.mov)
- Another red error dialog appears when you visit "Manage Boards" when you use Chrome (See problem3.png)
- Another red error dialog appears when you create a subtask from the backlog and only when you use Japanese (See problem2.mov)

Excerpt from the error message:
{noformat}
An exception has occurred in http://127.0.0.1:8080/s/389cefa756e99d05441edefd08894435-CDN/en_US-vyuule/64020/28/27dffb62c6d53c3687501abc152a3948/_/download/contextbatch/js/greenhopper-rapid-non-gadget,gh-rapid,atl.general,jira.project.sidebar,jira.global,jira.general/batch.js?jag_disabled_marketing=true&locale=en-US&isAdmin=true at 9194:277 --- Uncaught TypeError: a.hasAttribute is not a function
{noformat}

h2. Step to Reproduce
This is how I reproduced:
# Install vanilla JIRA 6.4.6 (current latest)
# Install JIRA Agile 6.7.4 (current latest) at 'Find add-ons'
# Create a scrum board and create a project for the board
# Create an issue, which will be stored in the backlog
# Create a Sprint, move the issue to it, and start it
# Install JIRA Service Desk 2.5.0 (current latest) at 'Find add-ons'
# Using Chrome, go to the backlog and see the red error dialog appears for only a moment (See problem.mov)
# Using Chrome, go to the "Manage Boards" and see the red error dialog appears (See problem3.png)
# Go to profile page and change the language to Japanese
# Go to the backlog and create a subtask, and see another red error dialog appears (See problem2.mov)
# The subtask is successfully created when you refresh the backlog page

h2. Findings
- It happens if you install JIRA Agile and then JIRA Service Desk
- It does *not* happen if you install opposite way (JIRA Service Desk -> JIRA Agile)
fields.summary: JavaScript error is displayed on JIRA Agile Boards after installing JIRA Service Desk

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Service Desk Server*. Using *JIRA Service Desk Cloud*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JSDCLOUD-2009].
  {panel}

h3. Summary
Agent leaving comment triggers duplicate notification to customer. 

h3. Steps to reproduce
* Create new Service Desk
** Confirm that by default desk is open and customer appears in customer list
* As agent, create issue on behalf of customer 
* Customer receives email, status shows waiting for support
* Agent adds comment using comment box and clicks "Send Response"
** TWO "Service Desk notification rendering mail item" appear in mail queue
* Two notifications received by customer, these are duplicates with conflicting status info. Screenshot attached

h3. Expected Results
The customer should receive only one email.

h3. Actual Results
* The notifications show different statuses
** Old status in one message, destination status in the other
* Both messages show correct destination step in message "Your request status changed to..."

h3. Workaround
Make the Agent use the Comment field in the *Respond to Customer* screen (while doing the transition with the *Respond to customer* button) instead of using the comment field in the View Issue screen. The customer will receive only one email as *Requester action Needed*.




 !Screen Shot 2015-06-23 at 2.40.00 PM.png!
fields.summary: Duplicate Notifications Sent to Customer

If you take *Browse Projects* permission out from the permission scheme, you are not able to create JSD issues by email
Currently, with the JSD > 3.2 it's possible to hide all request types from customer portal, but JSD will still display an empty project on the portal as below:

h3. Suggestion
It would be nice if JSD could hide a specific JSD project from customer portal when there is no visible request type just letting the issues be managed only by email.

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Service Desk Server*. Using *JIRA Service Desk Cloud*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JSDCLOUD-2006].
  {panel}

h5. Issue Summary
When a Service Desk issue is created directly in JIRA, the Customer Request Type is not set in the created issue.

h5. Steps to reproduce.
- Create a Service Desk project.
- Create an issue in this project directly from JIRA.
- Open the issue and look at the "_Service Desk Request > Request Type_" section.
- This will always show "*No Match*"
!SD Customer Request Type.PNG|thumbnail!

h5. Expected Result/Behaviour
- Service Desk picks the default Customer Request Type.

h5. Actual Behaviour
- Service Desk shows No match in the field in red.

h5. Possible Fixes:
- Service Desk sets a default value for the field.
- This field is automatically added to a Service Desk issue creation screen and is set to required.
fields.summary: Customer Request Type not Set when issue created from inside JIRA

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Service Desk Server*. Using *JIRA Service Desk Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JSDCLOUD-2003].
  {panel}

h3. Problem Definition
When creating an automation rules in Service desk project, there is only 3 option for SLA time remaining event:
* Due soon (60m remaining)
* At risk (30m remaining)
* Breached

h3. Suggested Solution
Need an ability to accept user input values for the condition. 

h3. Workaround
Similar feature can be achieved by creating an issue filter and then subscribe to the filter to get email notification. The JQL will be something like:
{noformat}
project = DESK and "Time to resolution" <= remaining("15m") and "Time to resolution" != breached()
{noformat}
*Note:* Please change the values accordingly to your environment.
This query will return issues in project "DESK" that it's SLA haven't breached and the remaining SLA is 15 minutes or less.

And then, for the filter subscription, you can choose to send an email every 15 minutes or use "Advanced scheduling ('cron')" for more detailed intervals; [Receiving Search Results via Email|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/JIRA063/Receiving+Search+Results+via+Email].
fields.summary: Ability to define custom durations for SLA triggered events for automation rules

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Service Desk Server*. Using *JIRA Service Desk Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JSDCLOUD-1999].
  {panel}

h3. Problem Definition
Updating Customer/Agent without transitioning.

h3. Suggested Solution
It is good to have an option to just update the Customer without transitioning the ticket status. As  statuses of waiting for customer and waiting for support make the assumption that each comment made by customers and agents hands the ticket back to the other party. This is not always the case.

h3. Workaround 

The new feature on Service Desk [Introducing automation in JIRA Service Desk 2.4|http://blogs.atlassian.com/2015/04/introducing-automation-jira-service-desk-2-4/] and [Automating your service desk|https://confluence.atlassian.com/servicedesk/automating-your-service-desk-733938388.html]

Using [JIRA Automation Plugin|https://marketplace.atlassian.com/plugins/com.atlassian.plugin.automation.jira-automation-plugin]
Unfortunately third-party plugins are out of our [support scope|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/Support/Atlassian+Support+Offerings]. To get support for the plug-ins you need to contact the related vendor as they have more experience. You can easily find the details of the plug-in at [Atlassian MarketPlace|https://marketplace.atlassian.com/].
fields.summary: Being Able to Update Customer/Agent Without Transitioning to Waiting for Customer/Support

{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Service Desk Server*. Using *JIRA Service Desk Cloud*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JSDCLOUD-1998].
  {panel}

I'm evaluating Service Desk v2 now.   I got all kinds of permission issues.  Ok I'm a Service Desk Agent (Reporter by default).  Whenever users submit a ticket, I receive an email with a link (see the screenshot below) letting me know some user just submitted a ticket.  But when I clicked on the link, I got "You do not have permissions to view this project".  I checked the "Permission" scheme and I as a Service Desk Agent, do have permission on almost everything. Wondering why I get that message?


Hello ServiceDesk Agent,

Thanks for submitting your request.

You can view the full request details in our Customer
Portal:

https://jira-test.vegaecm.com/servicedesk/customer/portal/5/CSSTI-41

  {panel}

h4. Environment
JIRA 6.4.6
JIRA Service Desk 2.5.0

h4. Steps to Reproduce
# Install Service Desk
# Create a new Service Desk project
# From the *Queues*, navigate the the first issue, *SD-1*
# Click *Respond to Customer*
# Click the *preview* button
# Click *Exit preview*

h4. Expected Results
The Rich Text Editor bar will still appear

h4. Actual Results
The Rich Text Editor bar disappeared

h4. Workaround
Close the screen, and trigger the transition again to bring back the screen + Rich Text Editor bar

project.name: Jira Service Management Server and Data Center

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Service Desk Server*. Using *JIRA Service Desk Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JSDCLOUD-1987].
  {panel}

h3. Problem Definition
Currently *JIRA Service Desk* is keeping emails in its database up to 6 months. This will cause customer's databases (and therefore backups) to grow very fast. 

Consequently, this may even impact the performance of JIRA as it, by default, automatically creates backups every 12 hours. 

h3. Suggested Solution
Remove emails that are older then 4~6 weeks, which would most likely be already obsolete. 

Alternatively, mark the email as "already processed" when it is processed, and delete those entries with the cleaner job.
fields.summary: Reduce the email age threshold for the JEPP cleaner job.

fields.description:
h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Setup your server at i.e.Sydney time AEST (UTC + 10)
# Client should access the server at later time zone i.e.AWST ( UTC
+ 8)
# Restart the Server to get changes applied.
# Add Due Date field to customer portal request type.
# Enter the due date while creating a new Service Desk ticket. i.e.30 June 2015


h3. Expected Behavior
In JIRA Core, Service Desk and Service desk customer portal you can see the Due Date as 30 June 2015

h3. Actual Behavior
In JIRA Core and Service Desk the due dates can be seen correctly 30 June 2015
but
In Customer portal, right after creating the issue the Due Date is one day earlier 29 June 2015
fields.summary: Different Time Zones of Server and Client Leads to One Day Earlier Due Date

Steps to reproduce:

1. Go to a ticket in the queue
2. Click on More
3. Click on Link
4. Select Web Link (this is not the relevant part, it happens with all types of links)
5. Put in a url, link text, and a comment
6. Set the comment privacy to be Service Desk Team
7. Submit the form

Expected:

Link is added and the comment is private

Actual:

Link is added, but the comment is visible to the requestor

fields.description:
Error occurs when uploading attachment to Service Desk from Internet Explorer 9.  Works in Chrome and newer versions of IE without issue.

Tested on IE Version {{9.0.8112.16421}}

h3.Steps to reproduce
# From Jira Service Desk Customer Portal
# Create a Service Desk Request
# Select add attachment
# Select file/image and attach
# Cancel the attachment and try a second attempt to attach a file

h3. Environment
* JIRA 6.4.5 with JIRA Service Desk 2.5.0
* JIRA 6.3.15 with JIRA Service Desk 2.3.6

h3.Expected Behavior:
File attaches

h3.Actual Behavior:
Attachment sits in waiting and never uploads (See Screenshots)
http://screencast.com/t/U83GxBb8qU

h3. Workaround:
This only occurs in IE9, use newer IE version or other Browser (Chrome, Firefox, Safari), until Fixed.
fields.summary: Cannot upload attachment to Service Desk using IE9

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Service Desk Server*. Using *JIRA Service Desk Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JSDCLOUD-1981].
  {panel}

A customer would like to be able to get the percentage of issues rather than the number that pass or fail an SLA.

*For Example:*
- Create an SLA.
- In reports, have a report to get issues that breached SLA.
-* This will show the number

*Wanted Feature*
- Add in a feature to show the percentage that meet the query as customer requires this.

*How this can be implemented*
- JIRA can currently count the number of issues  that meet a query as well as total number of issues within a particular (e.g. It can get the total number of issues in that SLA as well as the number that breached or passed the SLA).
- Allow JIRA to then compute using mathematical percentage equation the number that is expected and put this value in a field.
fields.summary: Show Percentage of Issues that Breach SLA in Report

fields.description:

  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Service Desk Server*. Using *JIRA Service Desk Cloud*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JSDCLOUD-1971].
  {panel}

h3. Summary
When using a Collaborator account to modify issues in a Service Desk project via API, users won't see a permissions error response - the operation will fail silently.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Set up a Service Desk project.
# Set up a user account with full access to the Service Desk project, but without the Service Desk Agent permissions.
# Use API authenticating with the account from point 2 to attempt to modify an issue in the Service Desk project.

h3. Expected Results
API call returns an error about the missing agent permission.

h3. Actual Results
The API response (201) indicates that the call is successful - it's only based on JIRA permissions and doesn't account for the Service Desk permissions override.
 
h3. Notes
Checking the Permission Helper indicates that the Collaborator account won't be able to edit the issue:
{quote}You are trying to perform an agent action on a service desk project. To perform this action, you must have a Service Desk agent license and both Browse and Edit Issue permissions on this project.{quote}
This information should be included in the API response.

h3.Workaround
Grant the API user Service Desk agent permissions.
fields.summary: API Responses Don't Account for Service Desk Permission Override

h2.Summary

We have a customer interested in allowing all customers that belong to a company to see issues filed by their colleagues.

h5. Use Case
Each company is given one portal and we can restrict who can access the portal by making it invite only so that only members of the company can see the portal.
However, members of each portal cannot still see each others issues nor can they add watchers directly to their issues but would rather need to ask the Agent to add the said customers as watchers so they get notified of progress.

h5. Possible Workaround
- Add a permission scheme at portal level for each Service Desk(A bit similar but not exactly the same as permission in JIRA that allows the Agent further control over customization of each portal.
- Add an option called "View all issues" in the portal Settings that shows or hides a link that allows all issue in the portal so customers can view all issues n the portal.

fields.description:
h3. Summary
Transition names in workflows are also used when setting up automation rules in Service Desk.
If a transition name gets edited and changed in the JIRA workflow, the Automation rules relying on those names will break. Beyond the automation section itself, no visible warning is being presented that rules have been broken.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Set up a clean JIRA installation
# Set up JIRA Service Desk and create a new Service Desk
# Go to the workflow used for this project, and rename the "Respond to customer" transition to "Rename"
# Publish the edited workflow

h3. Expected Results
Beyond the change in name no other effects should be expected
h3. Actual Results
The automation section of the Service Desk will display the following warning box:
!Screenshot.png|thumbnail!
The rules using the original transition name will cease to work.
 
h3. Notes
Workflows will remain working when a transition name is getting changed, because the workflows rely on the transition ID and not the transition name. The automation rules should also rely on the transition ID and not the transition name

h3.Workaround
The automation section displays the previously provided screenshot. Follow the instructions in order to fix the rules
fields.summary: Automation rules break on workflow changes

fields.description:
h3. Summary
When adding a participant to a service desk request, the wrong user gets added.
This only happens when both users are using the same email address.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create 2 users to JIRA with the same email address (user1 and user2). Make sure to use different Full names to keep them apart later
# Provide the appropriate permissions to the users so they function as Customers in a Service Desk
# Create a new request in the Service Desk
# After the request has been created, open the user search dialogue under the "Add People" section
# Search on "user" so both users created at step 1 get displayed using their full name
# Select user2 and click add

h3. Expected Results
user2 gets added as participant

h3. Actual Results
user1 gets added as participant
 
h3. Notes
The request payload from the Post call to add the user as participant to the request appears to *only* use the email address.
I have not been able out what actually determines which user gets added when there are multiple available ones with the same email address.
My initial suspicion was that the user created first was the one that gets created in JIRA.
However, a second reproduction attempt still confirmed a wrong user to get added, but not the first created user was picked (setup used more than 2 users with the same email address).

h3.Workaround
Currently no workaround is available.
fields.summary: When adding a participant to a service desk request, the wrong user gets added

h3.Summary
JIRA Service Desk status transitions email notifications are inaccurate if the status transitions are done in rapid successions. *This only happens in the customer's email notification; the agent and administrator notifications are fine*.

h3.Steps to Reproduce
# Assign a test user to a Service Desk request as a Reporter. This specific user must be a customer; make sure it's not an agent.
# Change the status of the request in fast rapid successions. From *Waiting for Support* to *Waiting for Customer* to *Resolve* and then back to *Waiting for Support*.
# Check the Service Desk notifications at the test user email.

!Untitled.png|thumbnail!

h3.Expected Results
The 'Your request status changed to <status>'  part should show the correct status.

h3.Actual Results
The 'Your request status changed to <status>' part is always showing the last status that is being transitioned to. In this case; it's waiting for support. So it's showing 'Your request status changed to waiting for support' for all the status transition notifications.

h3.Notes
Status transitions must be done in quick successions to replicate this issue. Also it only happens at the *customer side notification*.
fields.summary: Service Desk email status transition notifications are inaccurate if transitions are done in rapid successions

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Service Desk Server*. Using *JIRA Service Desk Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JSDCLOUD-1938].
  {panel}

Service Desk plugin has a number of screens but those screens does not have a context. As a result, other plugins cannot attach anything to those views like the portal page (servicedesk/customer/portal/XYZ). 
So, it will be useful to introduce a new web resource context for a portal page.


If your plugin adds a number of screens to the application, you may find it useful to introduce a new web resource context for your plugin that your plugin web resources (or any other plugin web resource) can hook into, to be automatically included on these screens.
To introduce a new context in your plugin Velocity templates, you can call the requireResourcesForContext() method on the WebResourceManager object from your Velocity templates:

$webResourceManager.requireResourcesForContext("com.acme.plugin.fancy-context")

This will include any resource in the page that specifies a context like this in its definition: <context>com.acme.plugin.fancy-context</context>.
fields.summary: Introduce new context for web-resourse

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Service Desk Server*. Using *JIRA Service Desk Cloud*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JSDCLOUD-1937].
  {panel}

{panel:title=Atlassian update as of 16th November 2016}{panel}
Hi all,

Thanks for all your comments. There's certainly strong interest behind this.

We would love to hear more from you on how your team shall add and maintain multiple languages on the portal. Understanding this will help us make the right thing that fits your needs perfectly.

If you would like to help out, please take 2 minutes to answer these questions - [https://jsd-beta.typeform.com/to/VS5QKT].

Cheers,
JIRA Service Desk Team

 
----
h3. Summary

If a JIRA Service Desk is created while the Default Language is set to a certain language, the customer portal will keep this language for the _workflow step_ and _why do you need this?_ text on the customer portal even after changing it to a different language.
h3. Environment

I have tested this behavior with the following:
 * JIRA 6.4.5
 * JIRA Service Desk 2.4.2

 * JIRA Service Desk-2.5.0-OD-02-002-D20150506T043445-language-pack-de_DE.jar
 * JIRA Service Desk-2.5.0-OD-02-002-D20150506T043445-language-pack-es_ES.jar

 * JIRA-6.4.5-language-pack-de_DE.jar
 * JIRA-6.4.5-language-pack-es_ES.jar

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Install the German (de_DE) language pack files for JIRA and JIRA Service Desk on your test instance.
 # Change Default language to _Deutsch (Deutschland)_
 # Create a new JIRA Service Desk
 # Create an issue
 # Install the Spanish (es_ES) language pack files for JIRA and JIRA Service Desk on your test instance.
 # Change Default language to _español (España)_
 # Go to the customer portal
 # Go to _My Requests_
 # Click on the issue you had created earlier

h3. Expected Results

The expected result would be that the Customer Portal translates all the fields according to the selected language.
h3. Actual Results

The customer portal keeps the translations of the language it was created in for the following:
 * _Workflow Step_
 * _Why do you need this?_ text
 !not_changed.png|thumbnail!

h3. Notes
 * If this is done with a language that does not have all the values translated those texts will also show up in the language the Service Desk was created in.
 * This issue occurs when the user profile language is different from the one the JIRA Service Desk was created in.
 * Even if the system default language is in english, and the user profile language is Spanish, these two pieces of text still are presented in German.
 * I have also verified that these 2 missing pieces of text are in fact present in bot the Spanish and German language pack:
 !PACK2.png|thumbnail!

h3. Workaround

Create the JIRA Service Desk in the language that you intend to use it in.
 (this might present a problem if the user profile language differs per user)
fields.summary: Changing the system language in JIRA does not translate everything on a Service Desk portal.

fields.description:
h3. Summary
The start and end time of a working day in a Calendar as can be found under SLA, can not get properly edited anymore after it has already been changed from the default values to anything else.
* The start time can not get changed to later (but can get changed to earlier)
* The end time can not get changed to earlier (but can get changed to later)
When trying to apply the changes, the original values remain in place 

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Navigate to the Calendar section under the SLA tab of a Service Desk
# Add a Calendar
# Remove all working days
# Add a new working day with a start and end time
# Adjust the start time to a later time or the end time to an earlier one
# Adjust the start time to an earlier time or the end time to a later one

h3. Expected Results
The changes made under steps 5 and 6 get applied to the working day

h3. Actual Results
The changes made under step 5 do not get applied
The changes made under step 6 do get applied
 
h3. Notes
The log files do not display any error messages.
The UI does not give any warning messages or displays any errors

h3.Workaround
If you want to change the values of a working day, completely remove the current day, and enter a new one from scratch.
fields.summary: JIRA Service Desk Calendars can not get edited beyond the first adjustment

fields.description:
h3. Problem definition
Custom Field assumes default values even if the field is set as empty on customer portal. 
On the create issue feature of JIRA, the field can be set as empty and once the issue is created the field will continue empty. However, on Service Desk, even if you set the field as empty, the issue will be created with the default value.

h3. Steps to reproduce the issue
# Create a custom field with the single select list and a default value.
# Add the field to the Service Desk request type.
# Create a Service Desk request with the custom field value 'None'.
(i) Video available -  [^SDbug.mp4] 

h3. Expected result
The created request will not have the custom field value because it was changed to 'None' before the creation.

h3. Actual result
The default value of the custom field is displayed in the created request.

h3. Workaround
* Do not specify a default value for the custom field OR
* Create an option to indicate none selected. For example, {{N/A}}.
** {{None}} cannot be specified as an option because it will not work.
** Since {{N/A}} is actually a value even though it means 'no value', the value {{N/A}} has to be specified in the JQL if you'd like to search for issues with "empty" value for the custom field.
fields.summary: Custom Field assumes default values even if the field is set as empty on customer portal

{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
*NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Service Desk Server*. Using *JIRA Service Desk Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JSDCLOUD-1924].
{panel}
Currently, the Email processor from under the Global Mail Settings will filter out:
 * auto-replied emails
 * mails marked as spam
 * delivery status notifications
 * emails originating from a JIRA instance

In certain situations, automatically generated emails from alarm systems or automatically forwarded emails, can have a different value than "no" set for the Auto-Submitted header of the email.
This will cause the email to get filtered out and not get further processed.
The AutoReplyMailFilter filter will prevent these kind of emails from creating issues in Service Desk.

Please provide an option to white-list email addresses to prevent them from being discarded as invalid emails under the Service Desk Email settings.
Alternatively, provide an option to disable any of the above mentioned mail filters from the Service Desk Email settings section

*WORKAROUND*

NB: This workaround is not possible in Atlassian Cloud.
 # Navigate to *Administration > Add-ons > Manage add-ons* (on newer versions of Jira this would be *Administration > Manage Apps > Manage Manage Apps* ) !screenshot-3.png|thumbnail! 
 # Look for *JIRA Service Desk* and expand the section 
 # Expand the _XXX of XXX modules enabled_  !screenshot-4.png|thumbnail! 
 # Disable these responsible modules of Service Desk:
 ** SD Bulk filter(sdBulkFilter) for messages marked as spam
 ** SD sent from JIRA filter(sdJiraFilter) for messages originating from a JIRA instance
 ** SD auto reply filter(sdAutoReplyFilter) for messages with a different value than "no" set for the Auto-Submitted header
 !screenshot-5.png|thumbnail! 

(!) The provided workaround will apply to all emails processed by the filter, which can cause incorrectly created issues. Being able to white-list addresses should prevent this from happening.
(!) To make sure that the right module has been disabled, run the query {{select * from pluginstate;}} and verify that {{com.atlassian.servicedesk:sdAutoReplyFilter}} is set to false.
fields.summary: Provide an option to allowlist email addresses to prevent mail from them from being discarded as invalid under Service Desk settings
